intro: Thapsia laserpitii, commonly known as the Lasaretto thapsia, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the Lasaretto region of Sicily. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white flowers during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
